Interface IConfigurationCollectionStore

Represents a store that can save and retrieve an aribtrary configuration collection representing a single emulator configuration file, associated with a game record

Namespace: Snowflake.Configuration
Assembly: Snowflake.Framework.Primitives.dll
Syntax
public interface IConfigurationCollectionStore
Remarks

To "delete" a configuration, just overwrite the existing values with a default instance

Methods

Get<T>(Guid, String, String)

Retrieves the configuration collection associated with this game record. This method is guaranteed to return a usable instance of the configuration collection. If a prior configuration has not been set, it should return a default instance with all properties initialized.

This function should return the same configuration values with identical GUIDs for the same database instance. This may imply that the function is impure; the default implementation will save every retrieved database using Set<T>(IConfigurationCollection<T>, Guid, String, String). internally. In other words, retrieval of a configuration may imply the persistence of the same configuration.

Declaration
IConfigurationCollection<T> Get<T>(Guid gameRecord, string emulator, string profile)where T : class, IConfigurationCollection<T>
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Guid gameRecord

The guid of the game record
System.String emulator

The name of the emulator this collection belongs to
System.String profile

The profile this collection belongs to
Returns
Type Description
IConfigurationCollection<T>

A valid configuration collection of type T
Type Parameters
Name Description
T

The type of configuration collection

Set(IConfigurationValue)

Updates a single existing configuration value, this will error if the GUID is not found in the database.

Declaration
void Set(IConfigurationValue value)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IConfigurationValue value

The configuration value with valid GUID and updated data

Set(IEnumerable<IConfigurationValue>)

Updates multiple existing configuration values, this will error if the GUID is not found in the database.

Declaration
void Set(IEnumerable<IConfigurationValue> values)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<IConfigurationValue> values

The configuration value with valid GUID and updated data

Set<T>(IConfigurationCollection<T>, Guid, String, String)

Saves and persists a configuration collection to the store.
